<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GEOPOLITICS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/10/28/davos-desert-take-three?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Third Time's the Charm for Davos in the Desert
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="davos in the desert " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTcyMjk0NzI5LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Following the murder of journalist Jamal Khashoggi last October, attendance at Saudi Arabia’s Future Investment Initiative (FII) last year was a bit sparse. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">A year later, many execs and financiers are back to <a href="https://www.axios.com/saudi-arabia-davos-desert-khashoggi-3d920991-3216-47f1-85e1-53e1da772166.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">following</a> the money, though plenty of controversy still surrounds this year’s “Davos in the Desert,” which kicks off today in <span>Riyadh. </span></p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">The backstory </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Saudi Crown Prince Mohammad bin Salman (MBS) has promised sweeping reforms to modernize and diversify the Saudi economy away from oil. To drum up foreign investment, he put on the first FII summit in Oct. 2017. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>3,500 people controlling ~$22 trillion in assets </span><span><a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2017/10/23/business/dealbook/in-the-saudi-desert-worlds-business-leaders-follow-the-money.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">attended</a></span><span>, including SoftBank’s Masayoshi Son, venture capitalist Peter Thiel, and Richard Branson. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>MBS then went on a charm attack during a spring break 2k18 U.S. tour, where he met with Rupert Murdoch, The Rock, Bill Clinton, President Trump, and Oprah. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">They welcomed MBS with open arms even though a quick Google search would have showed ties to purges of political rivals, a controversial war in Yemen, and human rights abuses. After the Khashoggi murder, execs and politicians abandoned the second summit in big numbers.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">A year later…</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">...all might not be forgiven, but things have warmed enough for leaders to come back to Riyadh. Among the ~6,000 visitors scheduled to attend this year: </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Indian PM Narendra Modi and Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Bridgewater’s Ray Dalio, Blackstone’s Stephen Schwarzman, and the CEOs of Citigroup and Credit Suisse </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Masa Son, on the hunt for Vision Fund 2 funding</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">In the U.S. delegation</strong></span><span>...Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin, Energy Secretary Rick Perry, and Jared Kushner</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Who’s not coming:</strong> Major U.S. <a href="https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/media-companies-skip-saudi-arabias-davos-desert-again-1249181?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">media outlets</a> (Fox Business, CNBC, Bloomberg, NYT). Big execs from the likes of Google and Amazon. Wall Street royalty like JPMorgan’s Jamie Dimon and Goldman Sachs’s David Solomon, who are <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/wall-street-returns-to-saudi-summit-but-khashoggi-murder-deters-some-executives-11572274294?mod=lead_feature_below_a_pos1&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">sending</a> other leaders instead. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>U.S. banks are in Riyadh hunting the <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2019/10/28/business/dealbook/aramco-ipo-saudi-arabia.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">big cheese</a>—Saudi Aramco’s potential IPO. The oil company could be valued at about $1.5 trillion.</p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TECH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/10/28/google-earnings-overshadowed-reported-fitbit-offer?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
There’s a Lot to Watch at Google
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Google ceo sundar pichai " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTcyMjk5MTk4LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, Google’s parent company kicked off Big Tech earnings for the week. Alphabet <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2019/10/28/alphabet-googl-earnings-q3-2019.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">beat</a> revenue expectations with $40.5 billion in Q3, but shares dipped after hours on a 23% profit slump to $7.1 billion. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Ad revenue hit a record $33.9 billion, though the segment’s growing at a slower clip while competitors (Amazon) ramp up their advertising game. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Per the NYT:</strong></span><span> “The performance </span><span><a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2019/10/28/technology/google-challenges-results.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">demonstrated</a></span><span> the challenges of trying to maintain growth at the company.” </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It's always difficult to assess the performance of other Google segments, such as cloud and phones. Google folds these into the “other revenue” category, which did over $6.4 billion in Q3. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Adding smartwatches to the mix? </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In January, Google acquired some of Fossil’s smartwatch tech for $40 million. Yesterday, Reuters <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-fitbit-m-a-alphabet-exclusive/exclusive-google-owner-alphabet-in-bid-to-buy-fitbit-sources-idUSKBN1X71NY?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">confirmed</a> the company’s still eyeing wearables by making an offer for Fitbit. The report sent Fitbit shares up 27%.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The acquisition would give Google an inroad to compete with Apple Watch, which </span><span><a href="https://www.strategyanalytics.com/strategy-analytics/blogs/wearables/2019/08/06/apple-watch-takes-46-smartwatch-share-in-q2-2019?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">commands</a></span><span> 46% of the global smartwatch market. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>In Q2, Fitbit lagged behind Apple and Samsung with 10% market share.</span></li>
</ul>

CRYPTO
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/10/28/bulls-roaring-good-week-crypto?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Good Crypto News Comes in Twos
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<img alt="coffee mug " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTcyMjk3NzcwLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Yep, we made this at <a href="https://photofunia.com" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">PhotoFunia.com</a>. It was really fun.</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">1. Coming 2020: The Starbucks Cryptoccino Experience </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Crypto platform Bakkt, an affiliate of NYSE owner Intercontinental Exchange, <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-crypto-currencies-bakkt/bakkt-to-test-consumer-app-with-starbucks-in-first-half-of-2020-blog-idUSKBN1X71Z5?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said</a> yesterday it’ll launch a consumer app next year with Starbucks as its first partner. It’ll be an all-in-one platform for users to “store, transact, trade or transfer” digital assets. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">There’s more: </strong></span><span>Killing two announcements with one </span><span><a href="https://medium.com/bakkt-blog/unlocking-the-value-of-digital-assets-bdda43214720?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">blog post</a></span><span>, Bakkt also said 1,179 monthly bitcoin futures traded last Friday, a record for the exchange.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">2. Coming TBD: The Chinese Blockchain Experience</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Chinese President Xi Jinping will never have to buy a round at crypto happy hours again.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Last Thursday, President Xi gave a speech <a href="https://www.theblockcrypto.com/post/44646/xi-jinping-says-to-let-china-take-the-leading-position-in-blockchain?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">urging the country</a> to “take the leading position” in blockchain, the technology underpinning cryptocurrencies. As Emerging Tech Brew’s Ryan Duffy <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/emerging-tech/stories/2019/10/28/president-xi-wants-china-world-leader-blockchain?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">notes</a>, the battle for blockchain supremacy opens yet another front in the U.S.-China Tech Cold War. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But chew it over and Xi’s speech tastes a bit...irony. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>China has banned cryptocurrencies since 2017.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Blockchain is fundamentally about decentralization, while Xi “almost epitomizes the notion of centralized power,” </span><span><a href="https://qz.com/1736514/xi-jinping-gains-popularity-in-crypto-world-with-blockchain-speech/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Quartz writes</a></span><span>. </span>
</li>
</ul>

</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">

<a href="https://ad.doubleclick.net/ddm/trackclk/N34504.3407870MORNINGBREW/B22107157.258550835;dc_trk_aid=454621056;dc_trk_cid=123538044;dc_lat=;dc_rdid=;tag_for_child_directed_treatment=;tfua=" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Moo" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTcyMDI1MjE1LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Why lead with a bad headline? You don’t. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">That’s the point: First impressions matter...<em>a lot.</em> Which is why if you’re a business, you need to nail your very first impression: <strong style="color:#000">your business card.</strong> </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">And for perfect business cards, <a href="https://ad.doubleclick.net/ddm/trackclk/N34504.3407870MORNINGBREW/B22107157.258550835;dc_trk_aid=454659950;dc_trk_cid=123649036;dc_lat=;dc_rdid=;tag_for_child_directed_treatment=;tfua=" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">there’s no company like MOO</a>. They set your business apart with premium paper stocks like extra-thick Luxe and custom finishes like “soft touch” and “high gloss.”  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But don’t stop with business cards. MOO’s expanded their high-quality paper products to satisfy all your <a href="https://ad.doubleclick.net/ddm/trackclk/N34504.3407870MORNINGBREW/B22107157.258550835;dc_trk_aid=454659950;dc_trk_cid=123649036;dc_lat=;dc_rdid=;tag_for_child_directed_treatment=;tfua=" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">marketing material needs</a> with postcards, notebooks, stickers, and more. Plus, for <strong style="color:#000">today and tomorrow</strong> <strong style="color:#000">only</strong>, MOO is offering <strong style="color:#000">30% off</strong> their non-card products.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">And if you’re a first time customer, remember the MOO Promise: <strong style="color:#000">If you’re anything less than ecstatic with your order, they’ll reprint it for free.</strong> Probably why they’re rated 4.8/5 on Trustpilot. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">So don’t lose business before you get started. Make the right first impression <a href="https://ad.doubleclick.net/ddm/trackclk/N34504.3407870MORNINGBREW/B22107157.258550835;dc_trk_aid=454659950;dc_trk_cid=123649036;dc_lat=;dc_rdid=;tag_for_child_directed_treatment=;tfua=" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">with MOO</a>. </p>
</td>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
FOOD
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/10/28/popeyes-chicken-sandwich-back-next-sunday?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The Second Coming of the Popeyes Chicken Sandwich
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Popeyes chicken sandwich " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC83MTgwL3BvcGV5ZXNfY2hpY2tlbl9zYW5kd2ljaC5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Popeyes</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Your spaghetti bolognese may get great reviews. But has it inspired <a href="https://www.timesfreepress.com/news/breakingnews/story/2019/aug/29/chattanooga-man-sues-popeyes-running-out-popular-chicken-sandwich/502385/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">legal action</a> or <a href="https://www.chron.com/news/houston-texas/houston/article/Popeyes-chicken-sandwich-gun-mob-14408492.php?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">threats of violence</a>? Popeyes’s mega-popular chicken sandwich has. When it first arrived in August, what the restaurant chain thought was a three-month supply evaporated in two weeks. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Now, the infamous sandwich is back. </strong>Popeyes <a href="https://finance.yahoo.com/news/popeyes-chicken-sandwich-returns-114255672.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">tweeted</a> yesterday that it’ll be a permanent menu item starting next Sunday, Nov. 3. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>We assume it’s an unfortunate coincidence that competitor Chick-fil-A is closed on Sundays. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Franchises are adding staffers to make sure they can handle the crush of customers. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">We know what you’re thinking: </strong>Less sandwich, more earnings. Just before the tweet, Popeyes owner Restaurant Brands International reported earnings and revenue that met expectations—but Popeyes’s comparable sales growth <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-10-28/popeyes-chicken-sandwich-to-return-sunday-in-chick-fil-a-slam?srnd=markets-vp&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">nearly doubled</a> projections at 9.7%. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out:</strong> The chicken sandwich’s success speaks to a) the superiority of all Southern food and b) the growing influence of social media. A Twitter spat between Popeyes, Wendy’s, and Chick-fil-A can <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/08/21/popeyes-chicken-sandwich-reveals-important-business-trends?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">take a good chunk</a> of credit for the sandwich’s August blowout.</p>

STARTUP
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/10/28/soho-house-scores-rooftop-poollevel-funding?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Soho House Scores Rooftop Pool-Level Funding
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Photo of a table and decorate wall at Soho House's Kettner's restaurant. " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://www.sohohouse.com/system/files/042019/5cc32d2af7c88bdde50003bd/xlarge/Copyright-Soho-House-Kettners-Club-Space-201904-MB-LR-003.jpg?1556295051">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Soho House</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><em>Welcome to the latest entry of Venture This. We’ll present you with a startup, then ask if you’d invest. </em></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The swank hotel and members’ club Soho House <a href="https://www.ft.com/content/5ae50af0-f971-11e9-a354-36acbbb0d9b6?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">has raised</a> $100 million at a valuation of $2 billion. While <a href="https://therealdeal.com/national/2019/10/28/it-doesnt-turn-a-profit-but-soho-house-is-now-valued-at-2b/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">unprofitable</a>, it plans to double its number of venues to 50 in the next three to four years. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">If you’ve never heard of Soho House</strong></span><span>, you must not be in need of a hangout spot between work, barre, and drinks at Le Coucou...that’s also a hotel.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">If you have heard of Soho House, </strong></span><span>then we don’t need to tell you it’s where Blair Waldorf and Serena van der Woodsen would hang out if they turned 25 and got into watercolors. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out:</strong> An unprofitable, expanding membership/coworking startup at a sky-high valuation...we’ve got déjà-Neumann. But Soho House founder and CEO Nick Jones said it shouldn’t be compared to WeWork because it’s expanding at a much slower pace.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">So....what’s the word from SoftBrew? Would you invest in Soho House? Tell us <a href="https://morningbrewdaily.typeform.com/to/YoXflm?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">here</a>.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">

<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>

The EU said the U.K. could leave the bloc on Jan. 31...or before that if both parties agree to a deal.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c/th\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso ]\u003e\u003c! -- --\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- \u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003c!-- END MARKETS --\u003e\n\u003c!-- ARTICLE ---\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso ]\u003e\u003c! -- --\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"c6 \" style=\"margin-bottom:7px\"\u003e\n\u003c!-- \u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003cth class=\"card\" style=\"text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px\"\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding: 15px;\"\u003e\n\u003ch3 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nGEOPOLITICS \n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/10/28/davos-desert-take-three?email={{profile.email}}\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nThird Time's the Charm for Davos in the Desert\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"davos in the desert \" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTcyMjk0NzI5LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFollowing the murder of journalist Jamal Khashoggi last October, attendance at Saudi Arabia’s Future Investment Initiative (FII) last year was a bit sparse. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eA year later, many execs and financiers are back to \u003ca href=\"https://www.axios.com/saudi-arabia-davos-desert-khashoggi-3d920991-3216-47f1-85e1-53e1da772166.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efollowing\u003c/a\u003e the money, though plenty of controversy still surrounds this year’s “Davos in the Desert,” which kicks off today in \u003cspan\u003eRiyadh. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThe backstory \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSaudi Crown Prince Mohammad bin Salman (MBS) has promised sweeping reforms to modernize and diversify the Saudi economy away from oil. To drum up foreign investment, he put on the first FII summit in Oct. 2017. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e3,500 people controlling ~$22 trillion in assets \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2017/10/23/business/dealbook/in-the-saudi-desert-worlds-business-leaders-follow-the-money.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eattended\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, including SoftBank’s Masayoshi Son, venture capitalist Peter Thiel, and Richard Branson. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eMBS then went on a charm attack during a spring break 2k18 U.S. tour, where he met with Rupert Murdoch, The Rock, Bill Clinton, President Trump, and Oprah. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThey welcomed MBS with open arms even though a quick Google search would have showed ties to purges of political rivals, a controversial war in Yemen, and human rights abuses. After the Khashoggi murder, execs and politicians abandoned the second summit in big numbers.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eA year later…\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e...all might not be forgiven, but things have warmed enough for leaders to come back to Riyadh. Among the ~6,000 visitors scheduled to attend this year: \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIndian PM Narendra Modi and Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eBridgewater’s Ray Dalio, Blackstone’s Stephen Schwarzman, and the CEOs of Citigroup and Credit Suisse \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eMasa Son, on the hunt for Vision Fund 2 funding\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eIn the U.S. delegation\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e...Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin, Energy Secretary Rick Perry, and Jared Kushner\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWho’s not coming:\u003c/strong\u003e Major U.S. \u003ca href=\"https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/media-companies-skip-saudi-arabias-davos-desert-again-1249181?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emedia outlets\u003c/a\u003e (Fox Business, CNBC, Bloomberg, NYT). Big execs from the likes of Google and Amazon. Wall Street royalty like JPMorgan’s Jamie Dimon and Goldman Sachs’s David Solomon, who are \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/wall-street-returns-to-saudi-summit-but-khashoggi-murder-deters-some-executives-11572274294?mod=lead_feature_below_a_pos1\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esending\u003c/a\u003e other leaders instead. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003eU.S. banks are in Riyadh hunting the \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2019/10/28/business/dealbook/aramco-ipo-saudi-arabia.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebig cheese\u003c/a\u003e—Saudi Aramco’s potential IPO. The oil company could be valued at about $1.5 trillion.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, Google’s parent company kicked off Big Tech earnings for the week. Alphabet \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2019/10/28/alphabet-googl-earnings-q3-2019.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebeat\u003c/a\u003e revenue expectations with $40.5 billion in Q3, but shares dipped after hours on a 23% profit slump to $7.1 billion. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAd revenue hit a record $33.9 billion, though the segment’s growing at a slower clip while competitors (Amazon) ramp up their advertising game. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003ePer the NYT:\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e “The performance \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2019/10/28/technology/google-challenges-results.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edemonstrated\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e the challenges of trying to maintain growth at the company.” \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIt's always difficult to assess the performance of other Google segments, such as cloud and phones. Google folds these into the “other revenue” category, which did over $6.4 billion in Q3. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eAdding smartwatches to the mix? \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn January, Google acquired some of Fossil’s smartwatch tech for $40 million. Yesterday, Reuters \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-fitbit-m-a-alphabet-exclusive/exclusive-google-owner-alphabet-in-bid-to-buy-fitbit-sources-idUSKBN1X71NY?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003econfirmed\u003c/a\u003e the company’s still eyeing wearables by making an offer for Fitbit. The report sent Fitbit shares up 27%.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThe acquisition would give Google an inroad to compete with Apple Watch, which \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.strategyanalytics.com/strategy-analytics/blogs/wearables/2019/08/06/apple-watch-takes-46-smartwatch-share-in-q2-2019?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecommands\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e 46% of the global smartwatch market. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIn Q2, Fitbit lagged behind Apple and Samsung with 10% market share.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-top: 12px;\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2019%2F10%2F28%2Fgoogle-earnings-overshadowed-reported-fitbit-offer\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"text-decoration: none;\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"\" style=\"display: inline-block; Coming 2020: The Starbucks Cryptoccino Experience \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eCrypto platform Bakkt, an affiliate of NYSE owner Intercontinental Exchange, \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-crypto-currencies-bakkt/bakkt-to-test-consumer-app-with-starbucks-in-first-half-of-2020-blog-idUSKBN1X71Z5?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esaid\u003c/a\u003e yesterday it’ll launch a consumer app next year with Starbucks as its first partner. It’ll be an all-in-one platform for users to “store, transact, trade or transfer” digital assets. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThere’s more: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eKilling two announcements with one \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://medium.com/bakkt-blog/unlocking-the-value-of-digital-assets-bdda43214720?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eblog post\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, Bakkt also said 1,179 monthly bitcoin futures traded last Friday, a record for the exchange.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003e2. Coming TBD: The Chinese Blockchain Experience\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eChinese President Xi Jinping will never have to buy a round at crypto happy hours again.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLast Thursday, President Xi gave a speech \u003ca href=\"https://www.theblockcrypto.com/post/44646/xi-jinping-says-to-let-china-take-the-leading-position-in-blockchain?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eurging the country\u003c/a\u003e to “take the leading position” in blockchain, the technology underpinning cryptocurrencies. As Emerging Tech Brew’s Ryan Duffy \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/emerging-tech/stories/2019/10/28/president-xi-wants-china-world-leader-blockchain?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003enotes\u003c/a\u003e, the battle for blockchain supremacy opens yet another front in the U.S.-China Tech Cold War. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut chew it over and Xi’s speech tastes a bit...irony. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eChina has banned cryptocurrencies since 2017.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eBlockchain is fundamentally about decentralization, while Xi “almost epitomizes the notion of centralized power,” \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://qz.com/1736514/xi-jinping-gains-popularity-in-crypto-world-with-blockchain-speech/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eQuartz writes\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYour spaghetti bolognese may get great reviews. But has it inspired \u003ca href=\"https://www.timesfreepress.com/news/breakingnews/story/2019/aug/29/chattanooga-man-sues-popeyes-running-out-popular-chicken-sandwich/502385/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003elegal action\u003c/a\u003e or \u003ca href=\"https://www.chron.com/news/houston-texas/houston/article/Popeyes-chicken-sandwich-gun-mob-14408492.php?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ethreats of violence\u003c/a\u003e? Popeyes’s mega-popular chicken sandwich has. When it first arrived in August, what the restaurant chain thought was a three-month supply evaporated in two weeks. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eNow, the infamous sandwich is back. \u003c/strong\u003ePopeyes \u003ca href=\"https://finance.yahoo.com/news/popeyes-chicken-sandwich-returns-114255672.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etweeted\u003c/a\u003e yesterday that it’ll be a permanent menu item starting next Sunday, Nov. 3. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eWe assume it’s an unfortunate coincidence that competitor Chick-fil-A is closed on Sundays. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eFranchises are adding staffers to make sure they can handle the crush of customers. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWe know what you’re thinking: \u003c/strong\u003eLess sandwich, more earnings. Just before the tweet, Popeyes owner Restaurant Brands International reported earnings and revenue that met expectations—but Popeyes’s comparable sales growth \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-10-28/popeyes-chicken-sandwich-to-return-sunday-in-chick-fil-a-slam?srnd=markets-vp\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003enearly doubled\u003c/a\u003e projections at 9.7%. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out:\u003c/strong\u003e The chicken sandwich’s success speaks to a) the superiority of all Southern food and b) the growing influence of social media. A Twitter spat between Popeyes, Wendy’s, and Chick-fil-A can \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/08/21/popeyes-chicken-sandwich-reveals-important-business-trends?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etake a good chunk\u003c/a\u003e of credit for the sandwich’s August blowout.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS While \u003ca href=\"https://therealdeal.com/national/2019/10/28/it-doesnt-turn-a-profit-but-soho-house-is-now-valued-at-2b/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eunprofitable\u003c/a\u003e, it plans to double its number of venues to 50 in the next three to four years. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eIf you’ve never heard of Soho House\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, you must not be in need of a hangout spot between work, barre, and drinks at Le Coucou...that’s also a hotel.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eIf you have heard of Soho House, \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003ethen we don’t need to tell you it’s where Blair Waldorf and Serena van der Woodsen would hang out if they turned 25 and got into watercolors. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out:\u003c/strong\u003e An unprofitable, expanding membership/coworking startup at a sky-high valuation...we’ve got déjà-Neumann. But Soho House founder and CEO Nick Jones said it shouldn’t be compared to WeWork because it’s expanding at a much slower pace.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSo....what’s the word from SoftBrew?
